bloodlessly adverb
(NO EMOTION)
often disapproving without emotion, especially when this is surprising or disappointing: The history is told as an unfolding drama involving real personalities, rather than a bloodlessly objective list of names, places, and dates. She tells her life story coldly and bloodlessly, until she talks about the man she describes as "the great love of my life".
More examplesFewer examplesThe writers use an academic tone and copious footnotes to suggest that they are bloodlessly analyzing the facts, rather than giving a highly partisan account.The cast is very good, but the production is bloodlessly serious.
